meanings.definition: Amebas: single-celled organisms that move and feed by means of pseudopods.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the amebas were seen moving slowly in the water.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study amebas to understand how single-celled organisms function.
meanings.sent3: The amebas in the pond had a race to see who could reach the other side first.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts floated like amebas, constantly changing shape and direction.
meanings.sent5: The amebas engulfed their prey with their pseudopods, like tiny hunters in the microscopic world.

meanings.definition: Amebas: a type of protozoan that is found in water and soil.
meanings.sent1: The amebas in the soil help break down organic matter to enrich the earth.
meanings.sent2: Amebas play a crucial role in the ecosystem by recycling nutrients in the environment.
meanings.sent3: The amebas in the water had a party, dancing around in their microscopic world.
meanings.sent4: The idea spread through the community like amebas, reaching every corner in no time.
meanings.sent5: The amebas in the soil were like tiny cleaners, tidying up the environment one speck at a time.
